result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Flortino Flores

Defendant Juan Flortino Flores not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Juan Flortino Flores.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial.  Defense is requesting a motion to adjourn for reasons stated on the record. State does not object.  Court granted defense motion to adjourn.  Case is adjourned to 1-17-23 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial, filed.

Defendant Juan Flortino Flores not in court, in custody.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 10-24-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Defendant Juan Flortino Flores not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Juan Flortino Flores.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pretrial.  Attorney Copeland is requesting an adjourned final pretrial to have time to speak with his client.  Case is adjourned to 10-11-22 at 2:30 pm for final pretrial by zoom.

Defendant Juan Flortino Flores in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Edgar Brooks  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. OFF THE RECORD: Parties are not present.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CRF (DOB: 01/09/1980), JCF (DOB: 06/18/2002), and JTF (DOB: 11/03/1998)

Defendant Juan Flortino Flores in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Juan Flortino Flores in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Flortino Flores appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
